event.descr:
The BGP Established event is generated when the BGP FSM enters the ESTABLISHED state.

f10BgpM2PeerLocalAddrType %parm[#1]%;

unknown(0) ipv4(1) ipv6(2) ipv4z(3) ipv6z(4) dns(16)

f10BgpM2PeerLocalAddr %parm[#2]%;

f10BgpM2PeerRemoteAddrType %parm[#3]%;

unknown(0) ipv4(1) ipv6(2) ipv4z(3) ipv6z(4) dns(16)

f10BgpM2PeerRemoteAddr %parm[#4]%;

f10BgpM2PeerLastErrorReceived %parm[#5]%;

f10BgpM2PeerState %parm[#6]%;

idle(1) connect(2) active(3) opensent(4) openconfirm(5) established(6)
event.logmsg: f10BgpM2Established trap received f10BgpM2PeerLocalAddrType=%parm[#1]% f10BgpM2PeerLocalAddr=%parm[#2]% f10BgpM2PeerRemoteAddrType=%parm[#3]% f10BgpM2PeerRemoteAddr=%parm[#4]% f10BgpM2PeerLastErrorReceived=%parm[#5]% f10BgpM2PeerState=%parm[#6]%

event.descr:
The BGPBackwardTransition Event is generated when the BGP FSM moves from a higher numbered state to a lower numbered state.

f10BgpM2PeerLocalAddrType %parm[#1]%;

unknown(0) ipv4(1) ipv6(2) ipv4z(3) ipv6z(4) dns(16)

f10BgpM2PeerLocalAddr %parm[#2]%;

f10BgpM2PeerRemoteAddrType %parm[#3]%;

unknown(0) ipv4(1) ipv6(2) ipv4z(3) ipv6z(4) dns(16)

f10BgpM2PeerRemoteAddr %parm[#4]%;

f10BgpM2PeerLastErrorReceived %parm[#5]%;

f10BgpM2PeerLastErrorReceivedText %parm[#6]%;

f10BgpM2PeerState %parm[#7]%;

idle(1) connect(2) active(3) opensent(4) openconfirm(5) established(6)
event.logmsg: f10BgpM2BackwardTransition trap received f10BgpM2PeerLocalAddrType=%parm[#1]% f10BgpM2PeerLocalAddr=%parm[#2]% f10BgpM2PeerRemoteAddrType=%parm[#3]% f10BgpM2PeerRemoteAddr=%parm[#4]% f10BgpM2PeerLastErrorReceived=%parm[#5]% f10BgpM2PeerLastErrorReceivedText=%parm[#6]% f10BgpM2PeerState=%parm[#7]%
